title: encoding/base64: NUL byte in input leads to wrong output
body:
by **mstplbrg**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Run this go program: http://play.golang.org/p/J6885vjGRj â€” it base64-encodes
"foo\x00bar"
2. Run base64 -d on the output ("echo Zm9vAGJh | base64 -d")
3. You get "fooba" instead of "foo\0bar"

What is the expected output?
Zm9vAGJhcgo=

What do you see instead?
Zm9vAGJh

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
8g

Which operating system are you using?
Linux (Debian testing)

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
go version devel +4d46cae98846 Thu Nov 15 11:46:00 2012 -0800
